senses.de: to accept and follow a rule, decision, or agreement
senses.ex: If you want to keep your job, you must abide by the company's rules.

Tips.title: Respecting Authority
Tips.description: Using 'abide by' shows you respect an authority setting rules.
Tips.example: We all need to abide by the school's guidelines.

Tips.title: Legal Seriousness
Tips.description: 'Abide by the law' is a serious expression often used in legal contexts.
Tips.example: Citizens must abide by the law to avoid penalties.

Tips.title: Commitment Emphasis
Tips.description: Emphasize commitment by saying you'll 'abide by' an agreement.
Tips.example: I'll abide by our contract and deliver the goods on time.
